title: The one thing that would IMMEDIATELY make ranked 10000000000x better
body:
Quit allowing players to play champions in ranked that they have little to no experience with.

I'm tired of losing games where my teammates have little to no experience on their champion, and they are basically the equivalent of beginner bots.

You should AT LEAST have mastery 4 on a champ before you can take it into a ranked game.

Ranked is SUPPOSED to be the mode where you take the game seriously. I'm tired of people goofing around in ranked and ruining games for others.

You've cherry picked an outlier instead of looking at the overall trend. It is usually the case that the more a person plays a champion, the better the person will get at that champion.

Sure knowing your champ makes you better, but if they suck at the basics principles of the game, it will only take them so far. 

People with better game knowledge > champion mastery. But when you don't have knowledge (looking at you autofilled players), then I'd rather them play towards their mastery.

i agree that you shouldnt be allowed to first time a champ in ranked.
but i dont agree on a mastery level needed. mainly cause mastery levels just say you played the champ a lot. not that youre good with it.

> [{quoted}](name=Jennifer420,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=4MFBEYJY,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-08-06T15:17:35.714+0000)
>
> i agree that you shouldnt be allowed to first time a champ in ranked.
> but i dont agree on a mastery level needed. mainly cause mastery levels just say you played the champ a lot. not that youre good with it.

Generally speaking, the more you play a champ, the better you'll get at it. Different people improve at different rates, and you'll always find individual cases where someone has played a champion a ton of times and still sucks on that champion. But the fact remains - there is a positive correlation between practising a champion and getting better at that champion.

I can tell you with all honesty, in my ranked games, there is a VERY strong, consistent correlation between feeding teammates and lack of experience on the champion they were playing.
That would just make you have to go through hours upon hours of meaningless mastery grinding. You'd need 20 champions at mastery 4 just to play Ranked. Not everyone plays that many champions.

> [{quoted}](name=KVbqbFsC8e,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=4MFBEYJY,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-08-06T03:58:48.950+0000)
>
> That would just make you have to go through hours upon hours of meaningless mastery grinding. You'd need 20 champions at mastery 4 just to play Ranked. Not everyone plays that many champions.

No, you only realistically need 4 champions to play ranked. 2 roles; 1 main and 1 backup for each role.
You need 20 champions because of picks/bans. If all 4 champions you had Mastery 4 on were picked/banned, you would have nothing to play.

> [{quoted}](name=KVbqbFsC8e,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=4MFBEYJY,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2019-08-07T01:08:06.132+0000)
>
> You need 20 champions because of picks/bans. If all 4 champions you had Mastery 4 on were picked/banned, you would have nothing to play.

The chances of that happening are pretty low. The player could dodge the game in those rare cases.

Just because _realistically_ you only need a small handful of Champions, that doesn't change the fact that if Mastery Rank was turned into a prerequisite for Ranked play, you'd _need_ 20 Champions at MRX to play Ranked - because you need 20 Champions unlocked to play Ranked in the first place.
Yea and how would smurfs be able to play?

Skill =/= mastery and vice versa. I have m5 on {{champion:164}} but I KNOW you would never want me playing her on your team in a million years.
Similarly, there are people with alt accounts, smurfs, or new accounts who would have to play a LOT just to get their onetrick to a high enough mastery - or people who are basically pretty good at almost every champ but haven't put the hours in. There's also a possibility that they played that champ on the PBE.
 There's just too many variables for this to be a viable option.

> [{quoted}](name=Mathgodpi,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=4MFBEYJY,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2019-08-07T01:05:26.044+0000)
>
> Why should I have sympathy for people who play on smurf accounts? They are basically wrecking the game for other players. If they have to grind more games in order to play ranked on their smurf account, I think that's actually a positive thing.

That's literally one example I gave. Someone forgetting their password on their old account, someone who's account got hacked so they started a new one, someone starting a second account on a new region to play with a different group of friends, someone who deactivated their account a long time ago and got back into the game, someone who played the hell out of a champ in the PBE or another region. They'd all be screwed over with a policy like this.

I'd just say level 2. If you have decent mechanics you don't need that many games with most champs to be proficient in them. Plus you need to account for bans...

Plus it would make smurfing more annoying, which is always a plus.
Whelp, my one top champ I have at m4 was banned. Time to break out Yuumi, or Janna top.

I've had a Janna top once a couple of years ago.  She won lane against a cho'gath.  To this day, I still don't understand how the hell did she took 1st tower with several kills on the cho (replay option wasn't available back then I think).  I'm not sure if our jg camped her lane, but I kept seeing enemy killed notice flashed across my screen for janna top.  I don't know the cho's elo, but definitely not bronze or silver.  We all thought the janna was trolling in champ select.

Seems logical to me, not much Cho can do to Janna. She has that huge speed boost passive, ludicrous peel, and does pretty startling damage when you let her. Cho wont be able to hit his knockup and will be outranged and harassed out of lane, or very vulnerable to ganks.

Mastery 4 would lock most of the champs i regularly carry in ranked (or anywhere) with.

Eject thyself, elitist.

I'm not an elitist. I'm just asking that players treat each other with basic decency. Basic decency means making sure you know how to play a champion before taking it into ranked. If you want to play for fun or learning, that's what normals are for.
